p: Although not illustrated in the table, the Illinois state had a total number of confirmed cases, n = 15,078, mortality, n = 462, with a case fatality of 3.06% on Wednesday, (4/8/20), while, on Thursday (9th April) there was a case fatality of 3.22% (case, n = 16,422, deaths, n = 528). As per US census projection, 2020, Blacks/AA comprise 14.6% of the Illinois population, but represent 27.9% and 43.2% of COVID-19 confirmed cases and mortality, respectively. The Wisconsin data on 13th April indicate the total confirmed cases, n = 3428, female n = 1817 (53%) and male n = 1611 (47%), mortality: male n = 92 (60%) and female n = 62 (40%). The Milwaukee County cases as per 13th April was n = 1743, and 94 deaths. In Wisconsin, Blacks represent an estimated 6.7% of the population by the 2019 US census estimate but constituted 25% ( n = 862) of all the confirmed cases and 42% ( n = 64) of all deaths.
